body: The admins are definitely more responsive than on reddit, but my point is a lot of the userbase isn't really on discord and they are separate communities. I've noticed that the culture of the two is actually considerably different, yet the discord has all the power. There's also the issue that the discord is quite circlejerky and a few popular users say something and everyone else just bandwagons with them, including the admins a lot of times, which consolidates nearly all the influence into a few hands. And yes, this type of setup is exactly what led to what we have on reddit.

## Posting Rules


Rule 1: 

This guild is for shitposting about people/events in the Ruqqus Discord server. Any post that is not related to this will be kicked to +general. If you need help regarding the discord server, +askruqqus, +general, or +hub would gladly accept your questions.


Rule 2:

No spamming. Spamming would be considered any of the following:

* Same-format posting within a day

* Same-content posting within a day (Same content, different format)

No reposts: reposts are cringe. Any reposts will be kicked.

parent.body: It's not a power trip when majority of the server doesn't appreciate your NSFW shitposting spam. A chat room must be subjectively moderated at some point and strike trolls and anti-community behavior. Impossible to have rules set in stone for a chat room since there's nuance and context to chat behavior. You're free to join another server where your NSFW spam is appreciated, discord is filled with it. You're not entitled to anything in the server.

parent.body: I feel this way too with life. I tend to think I'm pretty cool by myself, then I get around others and they are better than me. I definitely compare myself with others too much in most things. The thing about a site like this is you have some real good posters. And non-political content is really not popular on this site, so it's hard to grow right now. I guess just try to focus on the things you feel good about doing, and don't stress out about comparing yourself to others. Thanks for sharing, it's good to know I'm not the only one.

post.body:
I'm not intelligent enough for this site. I was born to be an average sheep who would still be using reddit and watching CNN right now.

I'm only smart because I've thought too much. I became fed up with the establishment early in life and began questioning things. Otherwise I'd have never noticed anything. I also have many interests (and I suck at doing all of them). There's a difference between smart and genius. Smart is what you work for and accumulate over years of work, study, research, and practice. Anyone can become smart, and I'm very smart in many areas. However, I'm definitely not a genius. Genius is what you're born with, talent and intelligence. Geniuses have an instinct or intuition that allows them to start out 10x better at something without trying than the most hard-working non-genius will ever get to. Genius is a whole new level, and it's not available for everyone. Geniuses are naturally smart, and unfortunately as a smart person, especially in an open-source community full of these people, almost everyone I know is a genius. I can't do anything they can do. I'm a tryhard, a wannabe or whatever. My existence here, at least in the early stages of this site, is pointless. I simply didn't inherit the right genes for this type of thing, or most things I want to do. I just wasn't born for it.

Most people here can do anything if they try even a little bit. Most active posters, even brand new ones, easily find 100s of great things in an hour, and super creative titles to go along with some of them. I on the other hand, despite 3 years of experience, can't manage to find more than one or two mediocre things in 2 hours that I haven't seen before. Most active commenters somehow find every single major post in the first 60 seconds and always get the top comments. Most devs here are true programmers, while I'm just a guy who copies and pastes things together and hopes it works. Even non-programmers completely blow me out of the water most of the time. And I've been at this for many years.

My problem is, I know a lot, but I'm dull. I'm the type who can pretend to be gifted, get good grades, etc. But when it really comes down to it, I'm nothing special. For example, you all are the people who can legitimately figure out a complicated math or science problem, whereas I can never do that. I have to be taught literally every step of everything, then I can copy it well enough, but never do it on my own. This is *crucial* for anything I want to accomplish myself; anytime I need to do something that's not been done before, I simply can't. I can't figure anything out. I can only copy others' methods. Yet you all have that genius instinct, to know how to do all these amazing things. I can't do that. I don't belong with you. You are all innovators. I am not, am uncreative, can't think outside the box, a talentless hack, etc. You are the people who make a difference. As for me, my only option is the usual college, job I hate, retire, then die, having nothing to do with my life. Try as I might, no amount of practice or desire will get me the talent I need to accomplish anything for real.

No, I'm not going to delete my account. But I'm not going to try and contribute as much anymore. It's pointless, a waste of time for me to try. You've all got it covered already. I'll just be around as a less active, more normal user.

post.body:
I'm not intelligent enough for this site. I was born to be an average sheep who would still be using reddit and watching CNN right now.

I'm only smart because I've thought too much. I became fed up with the establishment early in life and began questioning things. Otherwise I'd have never noticed anything. I also have many interests (and I suck at doing all of them). There's a difference between smart and genius. Smart is what you work for and accumulate over years of work, study, research, and practice. Anyone can become smart, and I'm very smart in many areas. However, I'm definitely not a genius. Genius is what you're born with, talent and intelligence. Geniuses have an instinct or intuition that allows them to start out 10x better at something without trying than the most hard-working non-genius will ever get to. Genius is a whole new level, and it's not available for everyone. Geniuses are naturally smart, and unfortunately as a smart person, especially in an open-source community full of these people, almost everyone I know is a genius. I can't do anything they can do. I'm a tryhard, a wannabe or whatever. My existence here, at least in the early stages of this site, is pointless. I simply didn't inherit the right genes for this type of thing, or most things I want to do. I just wasn't born for it.

Most people here can do anything if they try even a little bit. Most active posters, even brand new ones, easily find 100s of great things in an hour, and super creative titles to go along with some of them. I on the other hand, despite 3 years of experience, can't manage to find more than one or two mediocre things in 2 hours that I haven't seen before. Most active commenters somehow find every single major post in the first 60 seconds and always get the top comments. Most devs here are true programmers, while I'm just a guy who copies and pastes things together and hopes it works. Even non-programmers completely blow me out of the water most of the time. And I've been at this for many years.

My problem is, I know a lot, but I'm dull. I'm the type who can pretend to be gifted, get good grades, etc. But when it really comes down to it, I'm nothing special. For example, you all are the people who can legitimately figure out a complicated math or science problem, whereas I can never do that. I have to be taught literally every step of everything, then I can copy it well enough, but never do it on my own. This is *crucial* for anything I want to accomplish myself; anytime I need to do something that's not been done before, I simply can't. I can't figure anything out. I can only copy others' methods. Yet you all have that genius instinct, to know how to do all these amazing things. I can't do that. I don't belong with you. You are all innovators. I am not, am uncreative, can't think outside the box, a talentless hack, etc. You are the people who make a difference. As for me, my only option is the usual college, job I hate, retire, then die, having nothing to do with my life. Try as I might, no amount of practice or desire will get me the talent I need to accomplish anything for real.

No, I'm not going to delete my account. But I'm not going to try and contribute as much anymore. It's pointless, a waste of time for me to try. You've all got it covered already. I'll just be around as a less active, more normal user.

post.body:
I'm not intelligent enough for this site. I was born to be an average sheep who would still be using reddit and watching CNN right now.

I'm only smart because I've thought too much. I became fed up with the establishment early in life and began questioning things. Otherwise I'd have never noticed anything. I also have many interests (and I suck at doing all of them). There's a difference between smart and genius. Smart is what you work for and accumulate over years of work, study, research, and practice. Anyone can become smart, and I'm very smart in many areas. However, I'm definitely not a genius. Genius is what you're born with, talent and intelligence. Geniuses have an instinct or intuition that allows them to start out 10x better at something without trying than the most hard-working non-genius will ever get to. Genius is a whole new level, and it's not available for everyone. Geniuses are naturally smart, and unfortunately as a smart person, especially in an open-source community full of these people, almost everyone I know is a genius. I can't do anything they can do. I'm a tryhard, a wannabe or whatever. My existence here, at least in the early stages of this site, is pointless. I simply didn't inherit the right genes for this type of thing, or most things I want to do. I just wasn't born for it.

Most people here can do anything if they try even a little bit. Most active posters, even brand new ones, easily find 100s of great things in an hour, and super creative titles to go along with some of them. I on the other hand, despite 3 years of experience, can't manage to find more than one or two mediocre things in 2 hours that I haven't seen before. Most active commenters somehow find every single major post in the first 60 seconds and always get the top comments. Most devs here are true programmers, while I'm just a guy who copies and pastes things together and hopes it works. Even non-programmers completely blow me out of the water most of the time. And I've been at this for many years.

My problem is, I know a lot, but I'm dull. I'm the type who can pretend to be gifted, get good grades, etc. But when it really comes down to it, I'm nothing special. For example, you all are the people who can legitimately figure out a complicated math or science problem, whereas I can never do that. I have to be taught literally every step of everything, then I can copy it well enough, but never do it on my own. This is *crucial* for anything I want to accomplish myself; anytime I need to do something that's not been done before, I simply can't. I can't figure anything out. I can only copy others' methods. Yet you all have that genius instinct, to know how to do all these amazing things. I can't do that. I don't belong with you. You are all innovators. I am not, am uncreative, can't think outside the box, a talentless hack, etc. You are the people who make a difference. As for me, my only option is the usual college, job I hate, retire, then die, having nothing to do with my life. Try as I might, no amount of practice or desire will get me the talent I need to accomplish anything for real.

No, I'm not going to delete my account. But I'm not going to try and contribute as much anymore. It's pointless, a waste of time for me to try. You've all got it covered already. I'll just be around as a less active, more normal user.

body: The problem for me is, I'm just a tryhard surrounded by a bunch of true geniuses. Not the best ingredient for good self-esteem. I do certain things all the time but all of you utterly blow me away on the first attempt without even trying. It's hard to be smart and not a genius, because both have the same personality, and they tend to connect a lot, but the latter is much superior to the former. Geniuses are creative and can think outside the box, have a natural instinct for things, and a good working memory and a bunch of other super-advantages that I simply don't. I just know more than the average person. You all can do things well and do them right, and it just happens naturally. I on the other hand am a wannabe who tries very hard for a long time to just get "sort of" good, barely enough to do anything. Those are the two types of "smart" people, and being the smart-but-not-genius type surrounded by a ton of geniuses is extremely discouraging and eye-opening about the reality of how low my capabilities truly are. That's just bound to happen because of similar personalities, especially on a small open community that attracts those kinds of people in general. There's not much I or anyone else can do about it, I'll never be a genius because I just wasn't born one, and that can't be changed. If I ever want to accomplish anything, I'll absolutely depend on one of you to do all the actual legwork for me, as much as I hate missing out on it myself, I just can't do it. Just like how Notch had to let Jeb take over most of his projects, because he just wasn't talented enough to do what he wanted on his own.

It's hard to be smart and not a genius, because both have the same personality, and they tend to connect a lot, but the latter is much superior to the former. Geniuses are creative and can think outside the box, have a natural instinct for things, and a good working memory and a bunch of other super-advantages that I simply don't. post.body:
I'm not intelligent enough for this site. I was born to be an average sheep who would still be using reddit and watching CNN right now.

I'm only smart because I've thought too much. I became fed up with the establishment early in life and began questioning things. Otherwise I'd have never noticed anything. I also have many interests (and I suck at doing all of them). There's a difference between smart and genius. Smart is what you work for and accumulate over years of work, study, research, and practice. Anyone can become smart, and I'm very smart in many areas. However, I'm definitely not a genius. Genius is what you're born with, talent and intelligence. Geniuses have an instinct or intuition that allows them to start out 10x better at something without trying than the most hard-working non-genius will ever get to. Genius is a whole new level, and it's not available for everyone. Geniuses are naturally smart, and unfortunately as a smart person, especially in an open-source community full of these people, almost everyone I know is a genius. I can't do anything they can do. I'm a tryhard, a wannabe or whatever. My existence here, at least in the early stages of this site, is pointless. I simply didn't inherit the right genes for this type of thing, or most things I want to do. I just wasn't born for it.

Most people here can do anything if they try even a little bit. Most active posters, even brand new ones, easily find 100s of great things in an hour, and super creative titles to go along with some of them. I on the other hand, despite 3 years of experience, can't manage to find more than one or two mediocre things in 2 hours that I haven't seen before. Most active commenters somehow find every single major post in the first 60 seconds and always get the top comments. Most devs here are true programmers, while I'm just a guy who copies and pastes things together and hopes it works. Even non-programmers completely blow me out of the water most of the time. And I've been at this for many years.

My problem is, I know a lot, but I'm dull. I'm the type who can pretend to be gifted, get good grades, etc. But when it really comes down to it, I'm nothing special. For example, you all are the people who can legitimately figure out a complicated math or science problem, whereas I can never do that. I have to be taught literally every step of everything, then I can copy it well enough, but never do it on my own. This is *crucial* for anything I want to accomplish myself; anytime I need to do something that's not been done before, I simply can't. I can't figure anything out. I can only copy others' methods. Yet you all have that genius instinct, to know how to do all these amazing things. I can't do that. I don't belong with you. You are all innovators. I am not, am uncreative, can't think outside the box, a talentless hack, etc. You are the people who make a difference. As for me, my only option is the usual college, job I hate, retire, then die, having nothing to do with my life. Try as I might, no amount of practice or desire will get me the talent I need to accomplish anything for real.

No, I'm not going to delete my account. But I'm not going to try and contribute as much anymore. It's pointless, a waste of time for me to try. You've all got it covered already. I'll just be around as a less active, more normal user.

body:
You're still better than me, although JS isn't my main language and I'm probably way above you in C++. But in most cases, the devs here would literally destroy us in our main languages if it's one they barely even use. I guess we're both idiots, but that's not normal here. I probably know of 3-4 people total on this site that aren't extremely gifted. It's just frustrating being around everyone else's awesome achievements when I can barely do a few things merely decently.

I suppose it's better than giving up at least. I'll just have to rely on others if I ever want to do something. Which, admittedly, isn't that big of a setback: ![](https://i.imgur.com/CE0EaQY.png)

But it means I miss all the fun of doing it myself, and I can't truly make it my own.

I'm a tryhard, a wannabe or whatever. My existence here, at least in the early stages of this site, is pointless. I simply didn't inherit the right genes for this type of thing, or most things I want to do. I just wasn't born for it.

Most people here can do anything if they try even a little bit. Most active posters, even brand new ones, easily find 100s of great things in an hour, and super creative titles to go along with some of them. I on the other hand, despite 3 years of experience, can't manage to find more than one or two mediocre things in 2 hours that I haven't seen before. Most active commenters somehow find every single major post in the first 60 seconds and always get the top comments. Most devs here are true programmers, while I'm just a guy who copies and pastes things together and hopes it works. Even non-programmers completely blow me out of the water most of the time. And I've been at this for many years.

My problem is, I know a lot, but I'm dull. I'm the type who can pretend to be gifted, get good grades, etc. But when it really comes down to it, I'm nothing special. For example, you all are the people who can legitimately figure out a complicated math or science problem, whereas I can never do that. I have to be taught literally every step of everything, then I can copy it well enough, but never do it on my own. This is *crucial* for anything I want to accomplish myself; anytime I need to do something that's not been done before, I simply can't. I can't figure anything out. I can only copy others' methods. Yet you all have that genius instinct, to know how to do all these amazing things. I can't do that. I don't belong with you. You are all innovators. I am not, am uncreative, can't think outside the box, a talentless hack, etc. You are the people who make a difference. As for me, my only option is the usual college, job I hate, retire, then die, having nothing to do with my life. Try as I might, no amount of practice or desire will get me the talent I need to accomplish anything for real.

No, I'm not going to delete my account. But I'm not going to try and contribute as much anymore. It's pointless, a waste of time for me to try. You've all got it covered already. I'll just be around as a less active, more normal user.

body:
> Those same people might not be as good as you are when it comes to other things.

Not usually. The only time that's true is if they show zero interest and never do it in the first place. Everything they do try is amazing. But I'm the opposite. There are different strengths and weaknesses but I think it's just a matter of general intelligence more than anything. Some people have almost all strengths and few weaknesses, and others have hardly any strengths. In my experience, those who excel in one area also do the same in most others too.

I don't necessarily care about being "better" than them, but I want to be at a level good enough to do what I want to do. But I don't have the same doors open to me that they do, so that's not really a possibility for me as it is for them.

post.body:
I'm not intelligent enough for this site. I was born to be an average sheep who would still be using reddit and watching CNN right now.

I'm only smart because I've thought too much. I became fed up with the establishment early in life and began questioning things. Otherwise I'd have never noticed anything. I also have many interests (and I suck at doing all of them). There's a difference between smart and genius. Smart is what you work for and accumulate over years of work, study, research, and practice. Anyone can become smart, and I'm very smart in many areas. However, I'm definitely not a genius. Genius is what you're born with, talent and intelligence. Geniuses have an instinct or intuition that allows them to start out 10x better at something without trying than the most hard-working non-genius will ever get to. Genius is a whole new level, and it's not available for everyone. Geniuses are naturally smart, and unfortunately as a smart person, especially in an open-source community full of these people, almost everyone I know is a genius. I can't do anything they can do. I'm a tryhard, a wannabe or whatever. My existence here, at least in the early stages of this site, is pointless. I simply didn't inherit the right genes for this type of thing, or most things I want to do. I just wasn't born for it.

Most people here can do anything if they try even a little bit. Most active posters, even brand new ones, easily find 100s of great things in an hour, and super creative titles to go along with some of them. I on the other hand, despite 3 years of experience, can't manage to find more than one or two mediocre things in 2 hours that I haven't seen before. Most active commenters somehow find every single major post in the first 60 seconds and always get the top comments. Most devs here are true programmers, while I'm just a guy who copies and pastes things together and hopes it works. Even non-programmers completely blow me out of the water most of the time. And I've been at this for many years.

My problem is, I know a lot, but I'm dull. I'm the type who can pretend to be gifted, get good grades, etc. But when it really comes down to it, I'm nothing special. For example, you all are the people who can legitimately figure out a complicated math or science problem, whereas I can never do that. I have to be taught literally every step of everything, then I can copy it well enough, but never do it on my own. This is *crucial* for anything I want to accomplish myself; anytime I need to do something that's not been done before, I simply can't. I can't figure anything out. I can only copy others' methods. Yet you all have that genius instinct, to know how to do all these amazing things. I can't do that. I don't belong with you. You are all innovators. I am not, am uncreative, can't think outside the box, a talentless hack, etc. You are the people who make a difference. As for me, my only option is the usual college, job I hate, retire, then die, having nothing to do with my life. Try as I might, no amount of practice or desire will get me the talent I need to accomplish anything for real.

No, I'm not going to delete my account. But I'm not going to try and contribute as much anymore. It's pointless, a waste of time for me to try. You've all got it covered already. I'll just be around as a less active, more normal user.

parent.body:
It may be time for a radical change.  Completely changing the city you live in, the industry you work in, and your hobbies/lifestyle.  Most people don't chance that because the possible negative outcome if it doesn't work out well is scary.  But at some point, living a life you hate from now till death is even scarier, so you take that leap.

I'm not just spouting off random noise on the internet my friend.  I have done this very thing a few times in my life and am planning to do it right now at this moment.  And I have never regretted leaving a life I was unhappy with to move somewhere new, work somewhere new, and start over.

body:
> Not having a specific talent prevents you from resting on your laurels and it leaves you open to more possibilities. 

Not really, most people who are talented in one area are gifted all around. There are different strengths and weaknesses but there's also just general intelligence. For us mortals that's hard to understand, but I think for them they just have a flow or instinct to do these things naturally. That's probably why they don't believe us when we say we're trying and not getting the results, because they've never experienced that; for them, they usually get insane results as soon as they start something even if they don't try all that much. That's frustrating too.

> You're just always focusing on people who do better than you.

> Birds, flowers and trees don't need to be talented or "special" to be valuable and beautiful. Neither do you.

I know, but when nearly everyone you know *is* one of those types who is special and ultra gifted, and you're the only person you know who isn't, it's extremely hard to remember that.

That's frustrating too.

You're just always focusing on people who do better than you.

Birds, flowers and trees don't need to be talented or "special" to be valuable and beautiful. Neither do you.

I know, but when nearly everyone you know is one of those types who is special and ultra gifted, and you're the only person you know who isn't, it's extremely hard to remember that.

parent.body:
But trying to justify why you're shit isn't going to help. 
The value of a human being isn't necessary measurable in the way we can ascertain how a machine is valuable.
You have to have faith in yourself and other people. You have to try to understand that you don't need to understand your worth or how you are useful in this world.
You don't have a complete encyclopedic knowledge of all the things a person is capable of doing.
It might be nice to say that you have talent X or you're good at such and such, but that's mostly just a social tool.
It's more valuable to be willing to try. Not having a specific talent prevents you from resting on your laurels and it leaves you open to more possibilities.
You're not as awful and hopeless as you think. You're just always focusing on people who do better than you.
But you probably mostly post all of this stuff so that people will give you pep talks. I used to do that. What if people got tired of it and just ignored you completely? People do get tired of it. 
Birds, flowers and trees don't need to be talented or "special" to be valuable and beautiful. Neither do you.

But I suppose even talking is something to be proud of in my case. I don't know of many other animals who can do it.
body_html:
I know, but that's essentially just practice. You still have to work with with the base you already have, and you can get better, but not much better. Unless there's some treatment developed to improve areas of the brain. There's a reason why the majority of people don't make it.

But I suppose even talking is something to be proud of in my case. I don't know of many other animals who can do it.

parent.body: Look into neuroplasticity.  You can change your brain, the way you think, and, essentially, who you are.  There is hope.
parent.body_html: Look into neuroplasticity. You can change your brain, the way you think, and, essentially, who you are. There is hope.

post.body:
I'm not intelligent enough for this site. I was born to be an average sheep who would still be using reddit and watching CNN right now.

I'm only smart because I've thought too much. I became fed up with the establishment early in life and began questioning things. Otherwise I'd have never noticed anything. I also have many interests (and I suck at doing all of them). There's a difference between smart and genius. Smart is what you work for and accumulate over years of work, study, research, and practice. Anyone can become smart, and I'm very smart in many areas. However, I'm definitely not a genius. Genius is what you're born with, talent and intelligence. Geniuses have an instinct or intuition that allows them to start out 10x better at something without trying than the most hard-working non-genius will ever get to. Genius is a whole new level, and it's not available for everyone. Geniuses are naturally smart, and unfortunately as a smart person, especially in an open-source community full of these people, almost everyone I know is a genius. I can't do anything they can do. I'm a tryhard, a wannabe or whatever. My existence here, at least in the early stages of this site, is pointless. I simply didn't inherit the right genes for this type of thing, or most things I want to do. I just wasn't born for it.

Most people here can do anything if they try even a little bit. Most active posters, even brand new ones, easily find 100s of great things in an hour, and super creative titles to go along with some of them. I on the other hand, despite 3 years of experience, can't manage to find more than one or two mediocre things in 2 hours that I haven't seen before. Most active commenters somehow find every single major post in the first 60 seconds and always get the top comments. Most devs here are true programmers, while I'm just a guy who copies and pastes things together and hopes it works. Even non-programmers completely blow me out of the water most of the time. And I've been at this for many years.

My problem is, I know a lot, but I'm dull. I'm the type who can pretend to be gifted, get good grades, etc. But when it really comes down to it, I'm nothing special. For example, you all are the people who can legitimately figure out a complicated math or science problem, whereas I can never do that. I have to be taught literally every step of everything, then I can copy it well enough, but never do it on my own. This is *crucial* for anything I want to accomplish myself; anytime I need to do something that's not been done before, I simply can't. I can't figure anything out. I can only copy others' methods. Yet you all have that genius instinct, to know how to do all these amazing things. I can't do that. I don't belong with you. You are all innovators. I am not, am uncreative, can't think outside the box, a talentless hack, etc. You are the people who make a difference. As for me, my only option is the usual college, job I hate, retire, then die, having nothing to do with my life. Try as I might, no amount of practice or desire will get me the talent I need to accomplish anything for real.

No, I'm not going to delete my account. But I'm not going to try and contribute as much anymore. It's pointless, a waste of time for me to try. You've all got it covered already. I'll just be around as a less active, more normal user.
